column4: Hi, I have asked this question before, but here again: Anyone successfully installed nvidia-glx in Dapper ?. This package depends on one of the older kernel (2.6.15.11), which would screw up my system (2.6.15.27) after installing.
I had no problems with it; did you have security updates enabled?
You mean even you're running the latest kernel, installing nvidia=glx wouldn't cause it to be reverted back to the older one ?

What did apt-cache tell you about the dependency ?. Mine stays in 'pool/restricted/l/linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15/', hence it would complain if I didn't have the appropriate kernel installed. Any direction would be great.
Sorry, I switched to Edgy last night :-?
Which is from the 2.6.15.11-1 source package. (but that's fine).
That's right, and attempting to install it on my 2.6.15.27 kernel would be dangerous.
it goes wityh the 2.6.15-27 kernel from dapper-security/main
After that, I would have to choose between running an acient kernel with nvidia-glx or not at all.
You've installed nvidia-glx ? If so, I think I'll have a shot at Edgy.
sudo apt-get -s install nvidia-glx din't tell you that you need to install another kernel ? It's really wierd.
Nope. You should check that your sources.list is up to date,a s well as run 'sudo apt-get update'.
I cron "apt-get update/upgrade" on a daily basis. It should have the latest patches.
Thanks, guess I'll have to search and comeback in a while.
The mirror you use is perhaps out of sync; also if you sue any non-official repos, disable them for a moment.
Ahh no, I mean I did an update check very frequently, sorry for the miswording. :-p
